definition: to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect

sentences.english: Gold barrier off the news of the fall to the YangLinEr.
sentences.chinese: 金堤關被攻陷的消息傳到了楊林耳中。

sentences.english: Several years later, Syracuse was captured by Marcellus, the Roman general.
sentences.chinese: 幾年後，羅馬將軍馬爾塞魯斯攻陷錫拉丘茲。

sentences.english: To the north, Belgium had fallen.
sentences.chinese: 在北方，比利時已經被攻陷。

definition: to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to fall into enemy hands/to be occupied/to degenerate/to submerge
to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
to surrender (of a fortress)/to fall (to the enemy)/subsidence (of land)
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to massacre everyone in a captured city
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
